recipes.description: The fried green tomatoes are legendary in Alabama, they even inspired novella and film called Fried Green Tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Café.
ingredients: 1 roasted poblano chile, fresh or canned, seeded
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

image.description: Fried Green Tomatoes with Green Chile Mayonnaise

recipes.title: Fried Green Tomatoes with Green Chile Mayonnaise
recipes.directions:
§  Cut the tomatoes into slices of about 3/4 inch
§  Heat the oil in a medium large saucepan
§  Prepare 3 bowls – one with panko, cayenne spice and salt, second with flour and the third with buttermilk
§  First dredge the tomatoes in the buttermilk, then in the flour, then in the buttermilk again and finish with the spicy panko, coat thoroughly
§  Fry the tomatoes in small batches until light brown
§  Let it drain on paper towels
§  #Mayonnaise – boil the corn in salted water, let it cool
§  Remove the kernels, drain the liquid from the cob
§  Mix the corn and the liquid with mayonnaise, add sour cream and chilli, mix in a blender until fine, season with salt and pepper
§  Serve the dish with the mayonnaise, decorate with lime

recipes.description: Cornbread is an Alabama's traditional side dish for a variety of dishes. It's delicious with hearty winter soup, chili or stew meat.
ingredients: 2 cups cornmeal OR 1 1/2 cups cornmeal and 1/2 cup flour
recipes.title: Alabama Cornbread
recipes.directions:
§  Prepare a large saucepan, add bacon drippings and put it in the oven preheated to 400°F
§  Mix all the dry ingredients in a bowl
§  Whisk an egg with the buttermilk, add it to another bowl along with butter
§  Take the skillet out from the oven, put in the cornbread dough and bake for 20 minutes (try if its done with a toothpick)
§  Let it cool down for 10 to 30 minutes in the pan before serving it

recipes.description: Old traditional Alaska soup broth with moose meat, which is a typical delicacy for Alaska. The moose borsch is quite similar to the Russian borsch.
ingredients: 1/3 head cabbage cut into noodle-like pieces
recipes.title: Moose Borsch
recipes.directions:
§  Prepare the beans by soaking them in warm water for 3-4 hours
§  Cut the meat and put it in a large skillet, add 8 cups of cold water
§  Cover with a lid and heat on high heat, bring to a boil
§  When boiling, add the beans, whole beet and carrot, reduce the heat and cook for an hour
§  After 1 hour remove the beat and carrot, add the potatoes, bring to a boil
§  Add the cabbage and cook for approximately 15 minutes
§  Chop the onion, grate the carrot and the beet and add it to the skillet along with the tomato paste, season with salt and pepper according to your taste
§  Cook for 5 to 7 minutes with all the new ingredients, set aside for 20 minutes
§  Serve hot with sour cream

recipes.description: It is a popular dessert all over North America, but originally from Alaska. For this recipe is idela Rich Alaskan King Salmon, which has perfect meat for smoking and drying process.
recipes.title: Alaska Salmon Candy
ingredients: 1 pound skinless Alaskan Kingsalmon fillet, cut into 1/2-inch strips
recipes.directions:
§  Mix sugar with salt, spread onto a large plate and place the smoked salmon on the mixture, coat thoroughly from both sides
§  Put it in the fridge for 12 hours
§  Preheat the oven to 170°F
§  Scrape all the sugar from the fish, then dry it completely with a paper towel
§ Place the strips on a foil lined baking sheet
§  Let the salmon dry at room temperature for 30 minutes
§  Mix together all the remaining ingredients and glaze each stripe in it
§  Place in the oven, glaze and turn over the salmon every hour
§  An hour before it is finished, instead of coating it, season with black pepper
§  Bake until the stripes are slightly sticky but hardened, approximately for 6 hours
§ Serve at room temperature or store for later (for 1 week)

recipes.description: This adored burrito si originally from Tucson in Arizona. Chimichanga was born between the 1920's and 1950's and its flavour is influenced by the neighboring Mexican state Sorona.
ingredients: 1/2 cup vegetable oil, plus more for deep-frying
2 pounds boneless pork shoulder, cut into rough 1-inch chunks
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
One 12-ounce bottle pilsner beer, such as Corona
8 ounces tomatillos, husks removed, rinsed and quartered (about 3 medium)
1/2 bunch fresh cilantro with tenders stems (1 cup packed)
Guacamole, pico de gallo and sour cream, for serving
recipes.title: Pork Chimichanga
recipes.directions:
§  On a dutch oven heat ¼ cup of oil over medium-high heat, saute coriander and cumin seeds on it, add the pork, season with salt and pepper and fry until the pork is no longer pink (about 15 minutes), stir as needed
§  Add 8 ounces of beer and vinegar, stir properly from the bottom of the pan
§  Cook on medium-low until the meat is mild (about 45 minutes), then take the pork out and let cool, shred it and then give it back in the skillet, remove from the heat
§  Blend the onion, almonds, tomatillos, add cilantro and chipotles and 4 ounces of beer
§  Mix until fine, season with salt
§  Saute the green sauce on ¼ cup of oil on medium heat, cook for about 15 minutes until the sauce is reduced by half, stir frequently
§  Pour 4 inches of oil in a heavy bottomed pot for frying the chimichangas, heat to 375 degrees F
§  Mix the reduced green sauce with the shredded meat
§  Prepare the tortillas, spread cheese in the center of each, add the pork along the tortilla sideways, leave 3 inches at each end
§  Roll the bottom half over the filling, fold the sides, press it tight, secure with toothpicks if needed (not through the filling!)
§  Deep fry until light brown (about 3 minutes)
§  Serve with guacamole, pico de gallo or sour cream

recipes.description: This delicious pie is wonderful as a trimmings to any Barbecued meat, especially pork. The main ingredient is sweet onion, which is sweeter and have guite different flavor than common onion.
recipes.title: Arizona Sweet Onion Pie
recipes.directions:
§  Put crackers and 4 tablespoons of butter into the blender, mix until smooth
§  Line a 9 inch pan with the pie crust, press it tight
§  Put it in the fridge until needed
§  Preheat the oven to 350°F
§  Take a heavy skillet and heat the butter on medium heat
§  Stir fry onions and garlic (about 12 minutes) until soft
§  Spread the onions on the crust
§  Whisk eggs with milk, season with salt and mix in the chives
§  Cover the onions with the mixture and scatter with cheese and paprika
§  Bake in the oven for approximately 35 minutes 
§  Decorate with parsley, serve hot or at room temperature

recipes.description: In many rural areas of Arkansas, this breakfast staple is offered instead of oatmeal.
recipes.title: Rice Pudding
recipes.directions:
§  Put ½ cup of butter in a 12×8×2 inch baking pan
§  Let the butter melt in the oven, then remove and set aside
§  Prepare a large bowl, whisk eggs with sugar, add milk, spice with vanilla, nutmeg and salt, add rice
§  Spread the mixture on the pan, decorate with coconut powder
§  Bake in a preheated oven to 325°F for 1 hour without a lid
§  Serve hot

recipes.description: These popular fried pies are wonderful hot or cold and they are so versatile because they can be filled with your favorite fruits.
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup Crisco or 3⁄4 cup other good vegetable shortening
recipes.title: Fried Fruit Pies
recipes.directions:
§  Mix flour with salt, add the shortening and process with your hands or a blender until the mixture is crumbly
§  Whisk an egg with water, pour over the flour mixture
§  Add the vinegar and knead until the ingredients are well combined
§  Make the dough into a cylinder shape and refrigerate in a plastic wrap for at least an hour
§  Cook the dried fruit in the water on a very low heat for 30-45 minutes or until very soft (add water if needed)
§  Let it cool, mill the fruit a little and put it in a bowl
§  Mix in the spices and sugar
§  Take the refrigerated dough and cut it to four quarters, then every quarter to 3 equal pieces (you should have 12 balls of dough in the size of an egg)
§ Place the dough on a dry floured surface
§  Roll every ball into a circle
§  Spread about 2 tablespoons of the filling onto one side of the circle, wet the edges with water and fold the dough over the mixture, make a moon shaped pies
§  Press the edges with a fork properly
§  Preheat a deep fryer to 350°F and fry the pies one by one (for about 4 minutes) to light brown colour
§  Place the pies on paper towels, let the oil drain out
§  Sprinkle with powdered sugar, serve

recipes.description: California roll was supposedly created at a Japanese restaurant Tokyo Kaikan in Los Angeles about 1973. And it's known all around the world.
recipes.title: California Roll
ingredients: 1 teaspoon white sugar, or as needed
1/4 pound cooked crab meat, drained of excess liquid and shredded
1/4 cup red caviar, such as tobiko
1 English cucumber, seeded and sliced into strips
2 tablespoons drained pickled ginger, for garnish
2 tablespoons soy sauce, or to taste
recipes.directions:
§  Prepare a large pan, put rice and water and bring to a boil,then reduce to medium-low heat and cover
§ Cover a sushi rolling mat in a plastic wrap, keep it for later
§  Cook the rice for 20-25 minutes until all the water is absorbed and the rice is soft
§  Put the rice into a bowl, sprinkle with vinegar and mix carefully with a wooden spoon, season with 1 spoon of salt and 1 spoon of sugar
§  Let cool to room temperature for about 30 minutes
§  In another bowl, mix the crab meat with the mayonnaise, coat the meat thoroughly
§  Spread thin layer of rice on the nori sheet
§  Place the nori on a rolling mat, the rice side down
§  Start topping with avocado (about 2-3 slices), then the crab mix (2-3 tablespoons), then add tobiko on one side and sliced cucumber on the other side
§  Roll the nori carefully, press it tight
§  Remove from the mat, sprinkle with tobiko, wrap in plastic wrapper and let it cool in the fridge
§  When serving, unwrap from the plastic, cut to 6 slices using a wet knife
§  Serve with classic pickled ginger, wasabi and soy sauce

recipes.description: California burger is special because of avocado, which is one of the California's edible state symbols.
recipes.title: California Turkey Burger
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup cheese, grated (use a sharp cheddar, or pepper jack)
1⁄2 cup nonfat yogurt (strained Greek-style is great)
recipes.directions:
§  #Patties – mix the ground turkey with the spices and make burgers (4-8, depending on the size)
§  #Dressing – blend all the ingredients in a mixer, leave a few chunks
§  Cook the burgers either on a grill or on a pan
§  Serve on a toasted sourdough bread and avocado dressing
§  Decorate with baby spinach, onion or tomato and alfafa sprouts

recipes.description: These wonderful cinnamon rolls are among the Colorado's national dishes. And now you can bake your own slice of heaven.
ingredients: 1/2 cup vegetable shortening (such as Crisco), melted
1/4 cup plus, 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted, plus extra butter at room temperature for the bowl and pan
1/2 cup granulated sugar1/4 cup brown sugar
recipes.title: Colorado Cinnamon Rolls
recipes.directions:
§  #Dough – put yeast in warm water, it is ready to use when it is bubbling
§  In a blender mix sugar, shortening, ¼ cup of melted butter, milk and eggs
§  Add the yeasty water, blend together
§  In another bowl mix flour and salt together
§  Attach the dough hook to the blender above the bowl with the liquid
§  Add flour cup at a time to the liquid ingredients, mixing it in the meantime
§  Mix properly until the dough no longer sticks to the edges of the bowl
§  Place the dough on a flat surface and knead until soft (5 minutes)
§  Put it in a buttered bowl, cover with plastic wrap and keep at a warm place for about an hour to rise
§  Preheat the oven to 350°F
§  #Filling – mix granulated sugar, white sugar and cinnamon
§  Take the dough from the bowl, roll it to a rectangle about a quarter inch thick, 24 inch long and 10 inch wide
§  Cover the rectangles with melted butter, sprinkle with the cinnamon filling
§  Roll the dough from one long side to the other, cut uneven ends
§  Place the rolls on a buttered pan and put them in the preheated oven, bake for 20 minutes until golden
§  #Glaze – whisk the sugar, vanilla and milk
§  After 20 minutes take the rolls out of the oven, let them sit for 5 minutes and then spread the glaze over them
§  Serve hot

recipes.description: The Denver omelet is a bit like the Spanish omelet, but with different non-egg ingredients. And it's ideal for breakfast.
recipes.title: Denver Omelet
recipes.directions:
§  Melt butter in a skillet, add the chopped red bell pepper and stir with the onion
§  When soft, add the ham and fry for another 2 minutes
§  Grease a round pan and preheat the oven to 400°F
§  Whisk eggs with milk, mix in with the pepper, onion and the ham, add cheese and season with salt and pepper
§  Pour it on the prepared pan and place in the oven
§  Bake for 20 minutes or until golden, serve warm

recipes.description: These delicious cookies are among the Connecticut's national dishes. But Snickerdoodle came from Germany and the name originated from the German word Schneckennudeln, which means snail dumpling.
recipes.title: Snickerdoodles Cookies
ingredients: ½ Cup Butter or Margarine (Softened) – I use butter.
½ Cup Shortening (I use butter flavored shortening)
You will also need cinnamon and sugar for topping.
recipes.directions:
§  Prepare a bowl, mix cream of tartar, flour, salt and baking soda
§  In another bowl mix shortening, butter, eggs and sugar, blend thoroughly until fluffy
§  Slowly pour the flour mixture into the other bowl, stir together properly, let it cool in the fridge for 30 minutes
§  Preheat the oven to 400°F
§  Mix 2 tablespoons of sugar and 2 tablespoons of cinnamon
§  After 30 minutes, remove the dough from the fridge and make it into small balls, about 1 tablespoon of dough each
§  Cover every ball of dough in the sugar-cinnamon mixture
§  Place them on an aluminum foil, leave space between them as they will melt in the baking process
§  Bake for 6-8 minutes
§  Place the baked cookies on an absorptive paper, let the fat drain
§  Eat right away or store in a cookie tin

recipes.description: Mystic Pizza is one of the state dishes of Connecticut. Its name been created thanks to the romantic comedy "Mystic Pizza". In the movie the owner of the local pizzeria guarded her family sauce recipe with a secret blend of Portuguese spices. So there are many variants of this Mystic Pizza.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh or 1 teaspoon dried oregano
1 1/2 cups (6 ounces) shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese
recipes.title: Mystic Pizza
recipes.directions:
§  Dissolve the yeast in a warm water, set aside for 5 minutes
§  Mix with 1 ¼ cup of flour, oil and ¼ tablespoon of salt, stir to make a soft dough
§  On a floured surface knead the dough until it is elastic (about 10 minutes), use the remaining flour spoon by spoon, until the dough is no longer sticky
§  Place into a greasy bowl, let it stand until the dough is twice its' size (about 30 minutes)
§  Preheat the oven to 450°F
§  Put the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface, roll into 12 inch circle
§  Spray the baking sheet with cooking spray, sprinkle with cornmeal and place the pizza circle on it, crimp the edges a little to create a rim
§  Let it stand for 10 minutes (covered)
§  Saute the garlic for 2 minutes, then add the spices and tomato sauce, stir occasionally and cook uncovered on a medium heat for approximately 20 minutes
§  Pour the mixture from the pan onto the pizza dough, sprinkle with cheese and bake in the oven until the cheese is melted and the crust is light brown (about 10 minutes)
§  Cut into slices and serve hot

recipes.description: This delicious pie is among the Delaware's national dishes. And it is the perfect dessert after Sunday lunch.
recipes.title: Peach Custard Pie
recipes.directions:
§  #Crust – mix flour, salt and butter with a fork, make crumbs, start adding water one tablespoon at a time until the dough is soft
§  Form a ball, then roll it into a circle about 1/8 inch thick
§  Spread the dough over a pie plate, leave 1 inch overhang, cut the rest of the dough
§  Place it on the pie plate
§  Preheat the oven to 425°F
§  #Filling – in a large bowl whisk the sour cream, flour, sugar, egg yolks and vanilla and mix until smooth
§  Peel peaches and slice them to ¼ inch thickness, start folding them on the pie crust in circles (save some peaches for decorating the top later)
§  Pour the sour cream mixture over the peaches
§  Bake in the oven for 30 minutes, then set aside
§  #Streusel topping – crumble butter, flour, sugar and cinnamon
§  Sprinkle it on the top of the pie and bake for additional 15 minutes
§  Decorate with the remaining peaches, serve hot or let it cool down to room temperature

recipes.description: Soft crabs are easy to prepare and a true gourmet seafood delicacy. Soft-shell crab is a culinary term for crabs which have recently molted their old exoskeleton and are still soft.
recipes.title: Soft Shell Crabs
ingredients: 6 soft shelled crabs, cleaned and rinsed
1⁄2 cup dry white wine (I always use Sauvignon Blanc)
recipes.directions:
§  In a large bowl mix flour with the old bay seasoning
§  In another bowl whisk the eggs and milk
§  Start dredging the meat first in the eggs, then in the spicy flour, coat properly from all sides
§  Preheat oil in a large skillet over medium heat
§  Fry the crab in small batches, 3 minutes on each side until nutty brown
§  Place the crab on a serving platter
§  Add the butter to the heated oil, let it brown and then add the capers and the wine, cook for 1 minute
§  Add the lemon juice and parsley to the pan, cook for 2 minutes or until reduced by a third
§  Pour the sauce over the crabs, serve

recipes.description: No wonder it's the Florida state pie, it's perfect with seafood or any light dish and an ideal finish for any meal. Key limes are also known as Mexican or West Indian limes.
ingredients: 1/3 of a 1-pound box of graham crackers
2 teaspoons of lime zest - be sure to zest before you squeeze the juice!
2/3 cup of freshly squeezed lime juice (approximately 24-36 limes depending on freshness of limes), or 6-8 regular fresh limes (again, depending on freshness)
recipes.title: Key Lime Pie
recipes.directions:
§  Preheat the oven to 350°F
§  #Crust – place the Graham crackers into a zip-lock bag, seal and crush the crackers with a rolling pin
§  Scatter the cracker crumbs into a bowl, add the melted butter and sugar and mix until well combined
§  Press the dough properly to the pie pan, cover the edges as well
§  Bake in the oven for 8 minutes, then let it cool down (keep the oven on)
§  #Filling – separate the yolks and the whites, now use the yolks (keep the whites for later use)
§  Grate about 2 tablespoons of lime skin, then squeeze 2/3 cup of lime juice from all the limes
§  In a blender combine 4 yolks, add 2 tablespoons of the lime skin and mix on high speed until fluffy (about 5 minutes)
§  Add the condensed milk gradually, beat for another 3-4 minutes
§  Reduce the speed to slow, start pouring the lime juice and mix just until combined (not longer)
§  Pour the mixture over the pie crust and bake for 10 minutes
§  Take it out and let it cool down
§  Blend the egg whites with the cream of tartar, pour the sugar gradually and mix until firm
§  Place the meringue over the pie filling, seal it to the edges
§  Bake for another 5-8 minutes or until the meringue is golden

recipes.description: This dish is very popular and many Floridians can't wait for Summer because it means major scallop season.
recipes.title: Scallops with White Wine Sauce
recipes.directions:
§  Prepare a medium skillet, pour white wine, white vinegar and add the chopped shallots
§  Simmer until the liquid is reduced to roughly 1 tablespoon
§  Add the heavy cream and cook until reduced by half
§  Start adding the butter one tablespoon at a time, let it melt before adding another
§  Preheat the oven on the broiler setting
§  Sprinkle the scallops with olive oil, season with salt and pepper
§  Broil them 3 minutes each side until the edges are light brown
§  When serving, pour the sauce on the plate and add the scallops

recipes.description: Georgia is also known for its sweet Vidalia onions, which is among the Georgia's state symbols. So here is recipe for amazing Vidalia onion pie.
recipes.title: Vidalia Onion Pie
recipes.directions:
§  Preheat the oven to 350°F
§  Prepare the Ritz crackers into a zip-lock bag, crumble them using a rolling pin
§  Mix with melted butter
§  Prepare a pie pan, press the dough to it properly
§  On a skillet heat 2 tablespoons of butter and saute the onions until clear (not brown!)
§  Spread the onions over the dough
§  In a bowl mix eggs, milk, sprinkle with pepper and salt and pour over the onions
§  Top the pie with cheese and paprika, bake for 30 minutes until hard at the center

recipes.description: It is a popular traditional Georgia's dessert. Make it early in the day - the longer the peaches sit on the crust the better!
ingredients: pastry for double-crust pie (your own or Pillsbury pie crusts)
recipes.title: Georgia Peach Pie
recipes.directions:
§  Fold one refrigerated dough on a pie pan
§  Preheat the oven to 450°F
§  On a large pan saute sugars and cornstarch, season with ginger and vanilla
§  Add the peaches into the mixture and let it thicken for approximately 5 minutes
§  Let it cool and mix in the lemon juice
§  Pour the peaches over the pie crust
§  Cover with the second dough, seal properly at the edges, make small holes into the top dough
§  Bake covered with foil for 15 minutes, then for another 45 minutes without the cover
§  The pie is ready when it is bubbly and the edges are brown

recipes.description: Laulau is a Native Hawaiian cuisine dish. It is a typical plate lunch dish and usually served with a side of rice and macaroni salad.
ingredients: 4 pounds pork butt, diced into 2-inch cubes
2 pounds salt cod or salmon, cut into 12 to 14 cubes
30 ti leaves, middle ribs removed and reserved
recipes.title: Lau Lau
recipes.directions:
§  Prepare the taro leaves by cutting off the stems (be careful, do not make a hole in the leaf!)
§  Keep the stems for later use
§  Sort the leaves by size (every batch about 10 leaves)
§  Chop the stems
§  Sprinkle the pork with salt, put it in a large bowl, add the chopped stems and salt cod
§  Put the mixture in the center of each leaf, wrap it like a present and then wrap again with a second leaf
§  Secure each package with a kitchen thread
§  Cook in a steamer or traditional imu until well done (about 3-4 hours)

recipes.description: These delicious muffins are among the Hawaii's national dishes. They are wonderful with cup of tea or coffee.
recipes.title: Coconut Muffins
recipes.directions:
§  Mix flour, baking soda, coconut and salt
§  Mix butter and sugar until smooth, then add eggs and vanilla, beat well
§  Preheat the oven to 350°F
§  Drain and then chop the pineapple (keep the juice)
§  Prepare muffin pans and put paper cups in them
§  Combine the flour mixture with the butter mixture, add the juice
§  Place the pineapple to the paper cups and pour the dough over it, leaving the top third of the cup empty
§  Bake for about 20-25 minutes
§  Sprinkle with sugar, serve

recipes.description: Potatoes are the top producing crop and they are among the Connecticut's edible state symbols.
recipes.title: Twice Baked Idaho Potatoes
ingredients: 1 teaspoon olive oil (optional, for a softer-skinned potato)
Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
recipes.directions:
§  Preheat the oven to 400°F
§  Make holes in the potatoes with a fork, sprinkle with olive oil
§  Bake them for 50-60 minutes until they feel soft
§  Take the pan out of the oven, slice the potatoes lengthwise in half and start scooping the inside while they are still hot
§  Put the potato mash in a large bowl and press until smooth
§  Make the potatoes into small bowls about ¼ inch thick
§  Add sour cream and seasonings to the bowl with the potatoes, smooth with milk if necessary
§  Preheat the oven to 325°F
§  Start scooping the potato shells with the filling, then place them on a baking sheet
§  Bake for 18-20 minutes
§  Serve hot

recipes.description: They are typically served with French fries and a buttered piece of thick toast. They are commonly found in restaurants, bars, and fast-food joints in Southern Idaho.
ingredients: 1 pound boneless beef sirloin or cube steak (1/2-inch thick)
recipes.title: Finger Steaks
recipes.directions:
§  Carve the fat and the white pieces from the meat, chop it into strips with an approximate thickness of ½ inch wide and 2-3 inches long
§  Prepare a large bowl and combine the buttermilk with worcherstire sauce, 2 tablespoons of salt and 1 tablespoons of dry mustard, pepper, granulated garlic and paprika
§  Add the meat stripes and let them soak in the fridge for at least 2 hours
§  In another bowl mix the flour with 2 tablespoons of salt and 1 tablespoon of pepper, paprika, dry mustard and granulated sugar
§  Preheat 3 inches of oil in a dutch oven to 350°F
§  Take the meat from the fridge, dredge each piece in the spicy flour, then in the buttermilk and then in the flour again
§  Place the stripes carefully on the dutch oven, fry them in small batches for about 4 minutes until golden and crispy
§  Place them on an absorptive paper
§  Serve immediately with french fries and BBQ sauce

recipes.description: Chicago-style pizza refers to several different styles of pizza developed in Chicago. Arguably the most famous of these is the Deep Dish Pizza.
recipes.title: Deep Dish Pizza
ingredients: 3 1⁄4 cups unbleached bread flour, plus more for dusting
1 teaspoon table salt or 1 1⁄2 teaspoons kosher salt
more olive oil, for oiling bowl and pan
recipes.directions:
§  Put yeast in a large bowl and dissolve in ¼ cup of warm water
§  Sprinkle with sugar, add ¼ cup of flour and combine
§  Let it rest in a warm place, covered, for about 20 minutes
§  After 20 minutes add the remaining 3 cups of flour, salt, cornmeal, 1 cup of warm water and ½ cup of olive oil
§  Mix the dough with as much flour as possible
§  Put the dough on a floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic (10-12 minutes) until no longer sticky
§  Take a large bowl and grease it with olive oil, cover the dough in oil on all sides
§  Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, put a damp kitchen towel over it
§  Put in a warm place and let it leaven for 1 hour and 30 minutes to 2 hours (the dough should be twice its' size)
§  Knead once again for 3-4 minutes, then place it on an oiled deep dish pizza pan
§  Once the dough rises in the pan (15-20 minutes), press the dough until it is 2 inches on the sides and it is evenly spread at the bottom of the pan
§  Continue with any deep dish pizza recipe

recipes.description: A Chicago-style hot dog, also known  as the Chicago Dog or Chicago Red Hot is an all-beef frankfurter on a poppy seed bun, originating from the city of Chicago, Illinois.
ingredients: 4 hot dog buns (with poppyseeds if you can find them)
3 -4 teaspoons sweet pickle relish (bright green type if you can find it!)
1 cold-pack kosher dill pickle, quartered lengthwise
1 small tomatoes, sliced into julienne strips
4 -8 pickled sport bell peppers or 4 -8 tiny hot peppers (Kroger sells these)
dusseldorf-style brown mustard, with horseradish,to taste (may use yellow mustard)
poppy seed (omit if using seeded buns)
beer, for simmering (standard golden lager preferred; not authentic)
recipes.title: Chicago-Style Hot Dogs
recipes.directions:
§  Cook the Frankfurt sausages in water (or beer) for 10 minutes
§  Put the hot dog buns in the microwave (follow the instructions on the bag)
§  Take the sausage and place it into the bun, pour mustard over it
§  Garnish with dill spear, relish, tomato, onion and 1-2 sport peppers
§  Sprinkle with poppy seeds, decorate with celery
§  Serve right awa

recipes.description: The Indiana State Fair is known for its tasty fried treats! Deep-fried sauerkraut balls are a favorite.
ingredients: 8 ounces sausage, crumbled or 8 ounces beer, n' brat suasage
1 (14 ounce) can sauerkraut (squeeze dry and snip fine)
1 (3 ounce) package cream cheese (can use low fat kind)
recipes.title: Sauerkraut Balls
recipes.directions:
§  On a pan saute the sausage and onions until golden
§  Drain the fat and place into a large bowl
§  Add sauerkraut and 2 tablespoons of breadcrumbs to the bowl, mix in with cream cheese, garlic salt, pepper and mustard, sprinkle with parsley
§  Combine all the ingredients and let it cool in a fridge for 1 hour
§  In the meantime whisk eggs with milk and pour it into one deep plate, prepare a second plate and fill it with breadcrumbs
§  Take out the bowl and start making small meat balls, coat them with flour
§  Coat the balls first in the egg-milk, then cover them with breadcrumbs
§  You can finish your meatballs either in a deep fryer until golden or in an oven (15-20 minutes at 375°F)
§  Serve hot

recipes.description: This sugar cream pie is for sheer Indiana dessert perfection. It enrich every holiday dinner.
ingredients: Half recipe of flaky butter pie dough
recipes.title: Hoosier Pie
recipes.directions:
§  Prepare a refrigerated dough on a dry floured surface
§  Roll it to 12 inch circle and place it to a 9 inch pie pan, decorate the sides with a fork
§  Let cool for 30 minutes
§  Preheat the oven to 375°F
§  Place a baking sheet on the pie crust and weigh it with beans (you can reuse them later)
§  Bake for approximately 15 minutes (until the edges are golden)
§  Take it out of the oven, let chill, remove the paper with beans
§  Prepare a bowl and combine the sugar with flour, then slowly stir in the cream and vanilla
§  Pour the mixture over the crust and let it bake for 1 hour and 30 minutes until set
§  Let it cool down to room temperature, sprinkle with grated nutmeg before serving

recipes.description: This delicious snack is popular at food fairs and carnivals and it loved by people across the America.
recipes.title: Corn Dogs
recipes.directions:
§  Heat the oil in the deep fryer to 375°F
§  In a blender combine baking powder, cornmeal, flour, salt and egg, mix well
§  Add milk for better thickness, pour into a long glass and let it stand for a few minutes
§  Dry the hot dogs, coat with flour
§  Pierce the hot dogs with sticks
§  Start soaking them in the batter, let the excess drip off
§  Fry one by one about 5-6 minutes until nutty brown
§  Drain on paper towels, serve hot

recipes.description: The main culinary traditions in Iowa are heavily influenced by the European food culture. This popular soup is considered to be a main dish rather than a starter.
ingredients: chicken or vegetable stock, or ham cooking water or water, enough to cover
recipes.title: Pig Tail Soup
recipes.directions:
§  Put the tails in a large pan and add water
§  Bring to a boil, catch all the waste that is stocking on the surface
§  Add all the veggies and seasonings
§  Bring to a boil again, then reduce the heat and let it cook for 40 minutes until all the ingredients are soft
§  Put in the potatoes and simmer for another 15 minutes, add the dill and about 150 ml of gherkins pickling juice
§  Serve with pickles and rye bread

recipes.description: Kansas City-style barbecue refers to the specific regional barbecue style of slowly smoked meat that evolved from the pit of Henry Perry in the early 1900s in Kansas City, Missouri.
ingredients: 2 racks St. Louis-cut pork ribs (about 4 1/2 pounds)
6 cloves garlic, smashed and roughly chopped
1/4 cup firmly packed dark brown sugar
recipes.title: Kansas City-Style Ribs
recipes.directions:
§  #Rub – combine the paprika, sugar, salt, black pepper, onion, garlic powder and cayenne pepper
§  Preheat the oven to 275°F
§  Peel off the hard membrane that covers the bony side of the ribs
§  Brush the ribs with the rub from both sides
§  Place them in the oven on a baking sheet, bone side up, cover with a foil and bake covered
§  Bake until tender, for about 1 hour to 1 hour and a half
§  #BBQ Sauce – on heated oil saute the garlic, add tomato paste, paprika, red pepper, allspice, cloves and chilli powder
§  Cook for approximately 3 minutes until dark red, then add 2 cups of water, ketchup, soy sauce, worcherstire sauce, black pepper, salt, mustard, bay leaf, vinegar, molasses and brown sugar
§  Reduce the heat and cook for 30 minutes
§  Remove the bay leaf before serving
§  Take 1 ½ cup of the sauce, use it as a dip, the rest of the sauce use as the glaze for the ribs
§  After 1 ½ hours of baking, uncover the foil and glaze with BBQ Sauce, bake uncovered until the meat comes off the bone easily (about another 1 ½ hours)
§  Rotate and glaze the ribs every 30 minutes
§  Serve with barbecue sauce as a dip

recipes.description: This recipe is a great way to spice up an ordinary hamburger. Kansans love their barbecues and you will be close to the true food spirit of the land with this original Kansas' burger.
recipes.title: Kansas Grilled Cheeseburger with Mushrooms
recipes.directions:
§  #Patties – put the grounded meet in a large bowl, spice with ketchup, worcherstire sauce and salt, stir properly
§  Make patties depending on the size of the burger bun, approximately 1 inch thick
§  Grill the patties for 8 minutes from each side (the meat can not be pink)
§  When cooked, let it sit for 10 minutes
§  Heat the oil in the skillet and fry the mushrooms for about 6 minutes until soft
§  #Assembling the burger – start with the bottom roll, add the patty, sprinkle with the grated cheese and mushrooms, cover with the top roll and grill it upside down
§  When the cheese starts to melt, remove from the grill and serve

recipes.description: Kentucky Hot Brown (also known as a Hot Brown Sandwich) is an American hot sandwich originally created at the Brown Hotel in Louisville, Kentucky, by Fred Schmidt in 1926. It was created to serve as an alternative to ham and egg late-night suppers.
recipes.title: Kentucky Hot Brown
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
8 (1/2-inch) thick slices good day old white bread (recommended: Pullman or Pain de mie)
8 (1/2-inch) thick slices good day old white bread (recommended: Pullman or Pain de mie)
Roasted turkey breast, sliced into 1/4-inch thick slices
3 ripe beefsteak tomatoes, cut into 1/2-inch thick slices and griddled until slightly charred and just cooked through
16 thick slices slab bacon, cooked until crisp
recipes.directions:
§  #Sauce – In a medium skillet melt butter and add flour, cook for 1 minute
§  Pour in the milk and bring to a boil, whisking constantly, about 4-5 minutes until it thickens
§  Add cheese, nutmeg, salt and pepper, remove from the heat if the cheese has melted
§  #Egg bread – whisk eggs and milk, season with salt and let the bread soak in it
§  Heat the butter and the oil in a large saucepan and fry the bread 4 pieces at a time until light brown from both sides, let them drain on an absorptive paper
§  #Turkey – preheat the oven to 325°F
§  Cover the turkey with butter, sprinkle with salt and pepper
§  Roast in the oven for 15 minutes
§  After 15 minutes, reduce the heat to 350°F and bake until the thermometer shows 155°F in the center registers (about 1 hour and 30 minutes)
§  Take it out of the oven, cover loosely with tinfoil before slicing and serving
§  #Assembling – warm the egg bread from both sides using a broiler, for about 20 seconds
§  Put 2 or 3 slices of turkey and 2 slices of tomato on the top of each bread, pour the sauce over it
§  Place the cheddar cheese on one slice, the Parmesan on the other and broil until bubbly and golden
§  Decorate the browns with 2 slices of bacon and sprinkle parsley and chives over the top

recipes.description: Burgoo is a spicy stew, similar to Irish or Mulligan stew, often served with cornbread or corn muffins. Burgoo making in Kentucky often serves as a social event, in which each attendee brings one or more ingredients.
ingredients: 6 ounces bulk sweet Italian pork sausage
8 ounces chuck roast, cut into 1-inch pieces
2 chicken thighs, skinned and cut into bite-sized pieces
1 cup fresh or frozen corn kernels, thawed
recipes.title: Kentucky Burgoo
recipes.directions:
§  Prepare a dutch oven and stir fry the bacon on a medium low heat for 3 minutes, add the sausage and cook for 4 minutes or until golden, add beef and saute for 3 minutes
§  Add carrot, onion and celery, stir occasionally (cook for 5 minutes), then add chicken, salt and pepper (cook for 4 minutes), add garlic and quickly fry it – be careful, can't turn brown! (1 minute)
§  Pour vine, bring to a boil, let the liquid reduce by half (3 minutes), then add water and rice
§  Bring to a boil again, then reduce the heat
§  Cover with a lid and cook for 30 minutes
§  Add the potatoes, simmer for 20 minutes
§  Add the green beans and corn, cook for 8 minutes
§  Add chilli powder or sauce if desired, serve hot

recipes.description: Gumbo originated in southern Louisiana in 18th century and it’s a soup or stew. Gumbo is a reminder of the mix of cultures which live in southern Louisiana. This food combines the cuisine of Spanish, Africans, indigenous tribes, French, Italians and Germans.
recipes.title: Gumbo
ingredients: leaf parsley, coarsely chopped, chopped leaves for garnish
½ pound small shrimp, peeled, deveined and cooked
recipes.directions:
Heat the oil in a heavy bottomed Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Add the seasoned chicken and fry on both sides until browned.
Take out the chicken, add the sausage, saute until light brown, then take it out.
Strew ½ cup of flour onto the oil in the pan, add some margarine and fry over medium heat until the roux is brown and let the mixture cool to room temperature.
Return the pan to low medium heat, add 3 tablespoons of margarine and all the veggies and fry for about 10 minutes.
Add spices (parsley if you like), stir occasionally, cook for 10 minutes
Add 4 cups of water and bouillon cubes, then the chicken and the sausage, stir constantly and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat, cover with a lid and brew for 45 minutes. When all the ingredients are soft, add tomatoes and okra, cover it again and cook for another hour.
Before serving decorate with the green onions, shrimps and chopped parsley, serve with rice.

recipes.description: The Natchitoches Meat Pie is a regional food from northern Louisiana. It belong to official state foods of Louisiana. This popular recipe is over 300 years old.
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) package store-bought refrigerated pie dough, at room temperature
1 quart vegetable oil for deep frying
recipes.title: Natchitoches Meat Pies
recipes.directions:
Prepare a large saute pan, pour 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil and heat on medium – low heat.
Add flour, stir fry until it turns light brown (about 2-3 minutes).
Add a finely chopped onion and fry until soft (about 5 minutes). Crumble in the meat and cook for 15 minutes.
Mix in the spices. Pour fat out of the pan and cool to room temperature
Place the dough on a floured surface. Roll to an approximate thickness of about ¼ inch. Make a small round, then put the mixture in the center of each one.
Fold over the centers of the filled rounds and press the edges with a fork. Do that with all the pies.
You can finish your pies in a deep fryer or in an oven.
#For deep frying – preheat the oil to 190 degrees C. Start frying the pies, about 3 pieces a batch. The pie is ready when the dough has a golden brown colour (about 3-4 minutes). Place on paper towels to drain the fat.
#For baking in the oven – preheat the oven to 175 degrees C, place the pies on a baking sheet and bake for about 15 to 20 minutes.

recipes.description: It’s the street food of the rocky Maine coast. The lobster meat in the warm roll is usually served cold, rather than warm or hot.
recipes.title: Lobster Roll
recipes.directions:
§  Prepare a large pan with salted water, bring to a boil
§  Prepare a large bowl with ice water
§  Cook the lobster for 10 minutes until red, then place it quickly in the ice and let it cool for 2 minutes
§  Drain the lobster
§  Remove the meat and cut it to approximately ½ inch thin pieces, dry, wash in a strainer and then let it cool down for about an hour
§  Mix the lobster meat with mayonnaise, sprinkle with salt and pepper, add chopped celery, cayenne pepper and lemon juice and blend properly
§  Heat oil on a large pan, coat hotdog buns with the butter and let it turn golden on both sides
§  Fill each hotdog bun with shredded lettuce and the lobster mixture, serve immediately

recipes.description: This delicious pie is among the Maine's state dish. Blueberry Pies are often eaten in the summertime because it is blueberries season.
ingredients: One double recipe for butter pie crust dough
6 cups (about 2 1/4 pounds or 1 kilo) of fresh (or frozen) blueberries, rinsed and stems removed (if using frozen, defrost and drain first)
1/4 cup (about 30g) all-purpose flour or quick cooking "minute" tapioca (for thickening)
2 Tbsp butter (unsalted), cut into small pieces
recipes.title: Bluberry Pie
recipes.directions:
§  #Crust – place the refrigerated dough on a dry floured surface, roll to a circle about 13 inches wide in diameter
§  Place in a pie pan, leave ½ inch overlap
§  Cool in the fridge
§  Stir the blueberries with sugar, flour or tapioca, lemon zest, lemon Juice and cinnamon, coat every blueberry in the sugary mixture
§  Take the pie pan from the fridge, spread seasoned blueberries on it, add little sticks of butter
§  Preheat the oven to 325°F
§  Take the second dough, prepare like the first and place it on the filling, seal it properly with your fingers
§  Put the pie in the fridge again
§  #Egg wash – whisk milk and eggs, brush on the top of the pie
§  Pierce the dough with a fork a few times
§  Place the pie on a middle rack, put tinfoil under the pan in order to prevent spilling
§  Bake for 20 minutes at 425°F, then reduce the heat to 325°F and bake for another 30-40 minutes
§  Let it cool completely before serving

recipes.description: Blue Crabs is among the Maryland's official state symbols. Steamed Blue Crabs are popular for cold beer to be thrown on the crabs during the steaming process.
recipes.title: Steamed Blue Crabs
ingredients: 1/2 cup seafood seasoning, such as Old Bay
1 dozen live blue crabs, preferably males ("Jimmies")
recipes.directions:
§  Prepare a large pot, add 1 ½ cup of water, lager, vinegar and 2 tablespoons of the seafood spice, stir well, pour into the steamer
§  Place the crabs in the steamer, about 2-3 layers above the liquid
§  Sprinkle every layer of the meat with salt and the seafood seasoning
§  Cover with a lid and let it steam for 30 minutes (the crab should be light red colour, not green or blue!)

recipes.description: This delicious cake si among the Maryland's national dishes. Smith Island Cake is baked for any occasion and not reserved only for holidays. The cake is also baked as the feature prize for a local fundraising tradition called a cake walk.
recipes.title: Smith Island Cake
ingredients: 24 tbsp. unsalted butter, melted, plus more for pans
3 1⁄2 cups flour, plus more for pans
recipes.directions:
§  #Dough – grease and flour four 9-inch wide pie pans, set aside
§  In a large bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt
§  In another bowl whisk sugar, butter, vanilla and milk
§  Add the liquid ingredients to the dry ones, mix until well combined
§  Let it sit for 15 minutes, then whisk again until completely smooth
§  Pour half of the batter to the 4 prepared pans, cover only the bottom
§  Bake the cakes, rotating them in the process, about 15 minutes until brown
§  Take the cakes out of the oven, let them cool in the pans, then remove and let cool on a wire rack
§  Let the pans cool, then grease and flour them again and bake the remaining batter
§  #The icing – in a large pot bring chocolate, milk, sugar and butter to a boil, cook until the mixture is smooth (about 8 minutes)
§  Let it cool, stir in vanilla, when the mixture is cool enough to spread, start brushing it on each layer on the cake but one (leave the top one without the icing)
§  Chill for about 30 minutes to let the layers of the cake sit
§  Warm the remaining icing if necessary and glaze over the sides and the top
Serve cold

recipes.description: This delicious pie is among the Massachusetts' state dish. It is a wonderful combination of cake, custard and chocolate glaze.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more for pan
1 1/4 cups sugar, plus more for pan
3 ounces best-quality semisweet chocolate, coarsely chopped
recipes.title: Boston Cream Pie
recipes.directions:
Butter a 9 by 2 inch round cake pan, line with parchment paper
Butter parchment, sprinkle with sugar
In a bowl whisk flour, baking powder and salt
Use an electric mixer to whisk eggs and egg yolks for 1 minute (on medium speed)
Keep adding sugar and beat until light and fluffy (about 3 minutes)
In the meantime heat milk and butter in a small saucepan until hot over medium heat, do not boil the milk, remove from heat and stir in vanilla
While mixing carefully add hot milk to the mixture, slowly add flour mixture, ¼ cup at a time, mix until combined, move it to the prepared pancakes
Bake until the cake is done (about 40 minutes, should be golden brown, you can use a tester)
Remove from the pan, let cool completely
#Glaze – bring heavy cream to a boil in a small saucepan, put chocolate in another bowl and pour the cream over it and stir until combined, let cool for about 10 minutes
Assembly of the cake – get the pastry cream, beat until smooth
Cut the cake in half, spread the bottom half with the filling, top with remaining layering
Spread the glaze over the center of the cake
Chill for 20 minutes, serve

recipes.description: Clam chowder is often served in restaurants on Fridays in order to provide a seafood option for those who abstain from meat every Friday. It is particularly popular during "clamming" season when clams are in abundance and it is legal to dig your own.
ingredients: 2 cups russet potatoes (peeled and cubed 1/2" x 1/2" pieces)
recipes.title: Clam Chowder
recipes.directions:
Cook the potatoes in a large pot until soft
turn off heat, drain the water
Melt the butter on a 2 quart skillet, stir the onions and cook until transparent
Sprinkle the butter with flour and saute quickly, wait until it thickens
Add half and half a little at a time, stir (it should have a creamy consistency)
Add the clams with juice, potatoes, salt, bottled clam juice, pour in the milk
Bring to a slow boil on medium low heat
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, stir frequently

recipes.description: The pasty is popular world-wide and variations can be found in the United States, Australia, Argentina, Mexico and elsewhere.
ingredients: 3 medium potatoes, peeled and cut into tiny (pea sized)
black pepper, lots of black pepper
recipes.title: Michigan Pasties
recipes.directions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F
Put the refrigerated dough on a floured surface, cut circles from it using a small round plate
Mix all the ingredients for filling, stir properly until all the ingredients are combined
Divide the mixture into 5 batches
Put the meat on the center of each pastry, water the edges of the dough and fold, making a moon shape, seal carefully with a fork or fingers
Place all the pies on a greased baking sheet, make holes in each of them to let the steam out
Glaze them and bake for 45 minutes until light brown color

recipes.description: Michigan is famous for its cherry festival. And cherry is also the Michigan's national fruit. So here is recipe for amazing cherry pie.
ingredients: 5 or more c. frozen dry pack pitted red tart cherries
recipes.title: Michigan Cherry Pie
recipes.directions:
#Crust – pour 4 drops of almond extract to water
Line the refrigerated dough onto the pie plate (leave the exceeding dough)
Preheat the oven to 425°F
#Filling – Let the cherries thaw in a large strainer (keep the bowl under it to keep the juice), take 4 cups of fruit and 1 cup of cherry juice 
On a medium saucepan heat cornstarch, salt and sugar, gradually adding the reserved juice, until fine and clear
Add 1/8 teaspoon of almond extract, butter and the food color, let cool and toss in the cherries
Spread the filling onto the pie crust and decorate with the woman lattice top, seal the edges properly, cover the edge with a foil
Bake for 30 minutes, remove the foil and bake for another 10 minutes
Cool to room temperature, serve

recipes.description: Missouri does not have any official state food but it does have some edible state symbols and one of them is Morel mushroom. So here is one wonderful recipe.
ingredients: 1 -2 ounces dried morel mushrooms (or 8 ounces fresh morel mushrooms, cleaned and halved lengthwise*)
1 cup whipping cream or heavy cream

image.description: Morel Mushroom Cream Sauce with Pasta

recipes.title: Morel Mushroom Cream Sauce with Pasta
recipes.directions:
You can use either dried or fresh mushrooms
#When dried – heat 3 cups of the broth on a medium high heat, take away from the heat and pour the dried mushrooms in it
Let the mushrooms soak for 20 minutes
When soaked, pour the broth with the mushrooms over a clean cotton table cloth, reserve the broth 
Rinse the mushrooms in warm water properly, then squeeze out all the unwanted moisture from them
Slice the mushrooms lengthwise to even pieces, set aside
#Sauce – melt ¼ cup of butter on a large saucepan over medium high heat
Chop the shallots finely, add them to the pan and stir fry for 3 to 5 minutes until soft
Scatter with flour, stir together until combined
Pour 1 cup of broth over the mixture, stir carefully until well combined
Reduce the heat and cook uncovered for 7 minutes
Sprinkle with thyme, white pepper and ¼ tablespoon of salt
Add the whipping cream and stir slowly, cook for another 7 minutes, stir constantly until the sauce thickens
Mix in the morels and sprinkle with ¼ cup of parsley
Cook until all the ingredients are hot
Serve over pasta, decorate with parsley

recipes.description: This dish originates from and is popular in the Upper Midwest region of the United States, especially the states of Minnesota and North Dakota.
recipes.title: Tater Tot Hotdish
ingredients: 1 medium yellow onion, finely chopped (about 2 cups)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 cups frozen cut green beans, thawed (8 ounces)
1 3/4 cups frozen corn kernels, thawed (8 ounces)
Two 10-ounce cans cream of mushroom soup
recipes.directions:
On a large skillet heat oil over medium high heat
Saute the onions for about 15 minutes until golden
Add the beef, stir occasionally and cook until the meat is brown (about 10 minutes), when finishing the meat scrape all the bits from the bottom of the pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper
Pour the mixture into a baking dish, spread the corn and the green beans on the top evenly
Pour cream of mushroom soup over the mixture
Scatter with frozen potato nuggets
Bake for 1 hour at 350°F, the meal is ready to serve when the potato nuggets are brown and crispy

recipes.description: Mississippi's edible state symbols are largemouth bass, milk, wood duck, oysters and alligators. So here is one recipe for a alligator meat.
recipes.title: Blackened Alligator Steaks
ingredients: ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
½ teaspoon freshly ground white pepper
recipes.directions:
Prepare a large plate and mix all the seasonings
Coat the steaks with butter and dredge them in the seasonings, mix thoroughly from both sides
Prepare a large skillet, do not pour any fat into it and heat for 5-7 minutes
Put the steaks onto the pan and fry for 2 minutes on one side, turn them over and saute for 1-2 minutes, brush with butter

recipes.description: The name "Mississippi mud pie" comes from the dense cake which resembles the banks of the Mississippi River.
recipes.title: Mississippi Mud Pie
ingredients: 1 stick unsalted butter, cut into pieces
recipes.directions:
#Crust – blend the Graham crackers with the pecan nuts until smooth
Add the melted butter and continue to blend until the mixture is well combined and moist
Keep 2 tablespoons of the dough for later
Press the rest of the mixture into the bottom and up the sides of a 9 inch pie plate
Bake in a preheated oven to 350°F for approximately 10 minutes, then let it cool
#Filling – prepare the chocolate and the butter and put together on a medium heat on a sauce pan, let it melt
When melted, set aside from the heat and add salt and flour and stir until well combined
Slowly whisk in the coffee liquor, corn syrup, sugar and vanilla
Start adding the eggs slowly, stirring in the process until fine
When the filling is smooth, pour it onto the pie crust and bake for approximately 30 minutes until the top is cracked
Take out of the oven, let it cool for about 2 hours
Whipped cream – whisk together the heavy cream, confectioners‘ sugar and vanilla
Place it on top of the pie along with the reserved chocolate crumbles, pecans and chocolate sauce if desired
Serve slightly warm

recipes.description: Missouri does not have any official state food but it does have some edible state symbols - The Channel Catfish, Eastern Black Walnut and Norton/Cynthiana grape. So here is one recipe for a Catfish.
recipes.title: Baked Catfish
recipes.directions:
Prepare a large baking dish and brush with oil
Preheat the oven to 375°F
Take the fish fillets and dry them with paper towels
Mix all the dry ingredients in a bowl, set aside
Brush the fish with melted butter, then coat it in the bread crumbs properly from all sides
Place the fish on the baking dish, leave enough space between them
Bake in the oven for 20-30 minutes until the coating is golden and crispy and the fish flakes easily with a fork
Decorate with parsley and lemon wedges before serving

recipes.description: Fried Ravioli is an appetizer created and popularized in St. Louis, Missouri. Fried ravioli can be found on the menus of many St. Louis restaurants. Toasted ravioli may have originated in Sicily, where they are a traditional Christmas time dish.
recipes.title: Fried Ravioli
ingredients: store bought marinara sauce, heated, for dipping
recipes.directions:
Prepare a large skillet and pour about 2 inches of olive oil onto it, let it heat on medium heat until the temperature reaches 325°F
Prepare two bowls, pour the buttermilk into one and the bread crumbs to the other
Soak every single ravioli first in the buttermilk and then dredge it in the breadcrumbs
Place all the raviolis on a baking sheet until needed
When the olive oil is heated, start deep frying the raviolis, but be careful, they can not touch each other!
Turn the ravioli occasionally, fry until they are light brown color (about 3 minutes)
Place the pasta on an absorptive paper to drain
Scatter with grated Parmesan cheese, serve hot with marinara sauce as a dip

recipes.description: The taste of beef burgers and buffalo burgers is very similar, but that buffalo burgers are a bit sweeter and more tender.
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup dry red wine (such as Cabernet Sauvignon)
6 ounces sliced wisconsin white cheddar cheese
recipes.title: Bison Burger
recipes.directions:
On a large skillet add 1 tablespoon of oil, let it heat on medium heat and stir fry the onions until soft and golden (about 10 minutes), season with salt
Cook for another 15 minutes until brown and very soft, then pour the wine and simmer on medium heat for 5 minutes until the liquid is absorbed
Prepare a large bowl and mix the meat with the other ingredients, then make 4 patties about ½ inch thick, season with salt and pepper
Preheat the broiler
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil on a large pan over high heat
Start frying the burgers on the pan, about 2-3 minutes from each side, until brown
Prepare the buns, cut them open and place them on the broiler cut side up
Top with cheese and broil until the cheese melts for about 1 minute
Brush the bottom halves with mustard, garnish with escarole leaves and put the burger patty on it
Spread the top of the patty with the brown onion and cover with the top half of the bun
Repeat with all the burgers, serve immediately

recipes.description: This amazing cake is very popular and wild huckleberries will uncover the taste of the Montana countryside.
ingredients: 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
1 stick (8 tablespoons) cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
6 cups fresh huckleberries, or frozen thawed and drained
recipes.title: Huckleberry Pie
recipes.directions:
Filling – in a medium saucepan mix together 1 cup of huckleberries and ¾ cup of sugar, add orange zest and orange juice over medium heat
Cook for 5 minutes until the mixture is smooth and the berries are bursting
Let it cool for a moment
In a large bowl combine the tapioca with 5 cups of huckleberries
Pour the cooked berries into the tapioca mixture, gently mix together
Preheat the oven to 400°F
Crust – in a blender combine the flour, sugar and salt, add the shortening and blend together, then add the butter and mix until crumbly, pour the apple cider vinegar and 4 tablespoons of cold water into it, pulse to cosine, continue with adding water until the batter stays together
Place on a lightly floured surface, roll into 11 inches in diameter and 1/8 inch thick circle
Place in the 9 inch pie plate, cut off the edges and put it in the fridge to cool down a bit
Pour the huckleberries into the pie shell, place the smaller circle of dough about 1/8 thick on top of the pie, seal the edges and crimp them decoratively
Make small slits into the top dough
Combine the egg with 1 teaspoon of water and cover the top with it, scatter with the remaining sugar (2 tablespoons)
Bake the cake on a baking sheet for 15 minutes (at 400°F), then reduce to 375°F and bake until golden brown and the filling is bubbling, about 50 minutes
Let cool before serving, serve with whipped cream

recipes.description: Nebraska has many ethnic groups, and each of them brought some traditional food. Here is one recipe form Czech Americans.
recipes.title: Kolaches
recipes.directions:
Warm milk on low heat, do not boil, cool it to room temperature
Pour yeast into warm water and let dissolve
Whisk butter, sugar, salt and egg yolks together until smooth
Pour the yeasty water into the butter mixture, add milk and ½ cup of flour, whisk for 5 minutes on medium heat until smooth
Scatter with flour gradually and knead until the batter no longer sticks to the edges of the bowl
Prepare a lightly greased bowl, grease the batter from all sides
Let the batter rise at a warm place, covered, for about 1 to 1 hour 30 minutes until doubled in size
Put on a lightly floured surface and make 24 balls
Cover the dough and let rest for 10 to 15 minutes
Prune filling – Prepare 30 prunes, cook until soft, drain, mill, add ¼ cup of sugar and ¼ tablespoon ground allspice (14 portions)
Apricot filling – prepare 25 apricot halves, cook until soft, drain, mill/blend/mash the apricots, add ¼ cup of sugar (10 portions)
Arrange the kolaches on a greased baking sheet about 2 inches apart from each other
Knead each ball of batter from center outward with fingers to make a hole in center with a ½ inch rim around the edge
Place 1 tablespoon of the filling in the hollow
Cover again and let it rest in a warm place for 30 to 40 minutes
Preheat the oven to 350°F
Bake the kolaches for 15 to 18 minutes until golden, cover the edges with melted butter and scatter with powdered sugar, place on racks to cool

recipes.description: These meat pies are very popular. They are built to travel - great make ahead and heated for lunch.
ingredients: 1/2 cup warm water (110 to 115 degrees F)
2 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, plus more if needed
3 cups chopped green cabbage (about 1/2 large head)
2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted, for brushing
recipes.title: Nebraska Handheld Meat Pies
recipes.directions:
#Dough – dissolve the yeast in warm water and stir in 1 tablespoon of sugar
Set aside until the yeast is bubbly on the top (about 10 minutes)
In a large pot heat milk with butter and cook until the butter melts, cool to 115°F
Mix the flour, salt and sugar in the bowl of a mixer with a dough hook, pour the yeasty water and the cooled milk over the flour mixture, start processing it with the dough hook
The dough is ready when smooth and no longer sticks to the edges of the bowl, that should take about 5 minutes
Cover with a plastic wrap and let it leaven at a warm place for 1 hour and 30 minutes at least
#Filling – on a heated tablespoon of oil saute the meat until brown and crumbles to little pieces (about 5 minutes), season with ½ tablespoon of salt
Transfer the meat into a large bowl
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil on the skillet and add the cabbage and onions, simmer until soft and tender (about 15 minutes), season with 1 tablespoon of salt
After 15 minutes add the beef back to the pan and cook it for another 5 minutes with the cabbage and onions
Season with white pepper and additional salt if desired
Take away from the heat and let it chill completely
Put the dough onto a floured surface, punch down the mass and separate into 10 balls of dough
Roll each one into a rectangle about 6 by 8 inches
Spoon the cold filling in the center of each rectangle, fold the two long sides together and pinch it together (the seam is facing up)
Pinch the short sides as well
Arrange the pies on a baking sheet, cover them with a kitchen towel and let them sit for about 20 minutes before baking
Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F for approximately 22 minutes until nutty brown 
Serve with ketchup, serve hot

recipes.description: Do you like these crispy golden rings? Then you should know, this delicacy was born in Nevada.
recipes.title: Onion rings
ingredients: 1 quart oil for frying, or as needed
recipes.directions:
Slice the onions and divide them into individual onion rings
Preheat the deep fryer to 365°F
On a plate mix together the flour, baking powder and salt
Beat eggs and milk together
Scatter breadcrumbs on a shallow plate 
Cover every onion ring in the flour mixture, set aside
Pour the egg mixture into the flour mixture, whisk until well combined
Dip every onion in the mixture and put on an aluminum foil
Dredge the rings in the bread crumbs, coat evenly from all sides, press the mixture properly into the onion
Start frying the rings in small batches, they are ready when golden brown (about 2-3 minutes)
Place them on a kitchen towel to drain
Sprinkle with salt, serve hot

recipes.description: This delicious salad served in a local Basque houses. It is simple, but has a lot of flavor, especially if you like garlic! This salad is best served with chicken or steak.
recipes.title: Basque Salad
recipes.directions:
Chop the hard boiled egg and crush the garlic cloves
In a large bowl mix the olive oil, crushed garlic, apple cider vinegar, salt, garlic powder, mayonnaise and the chopped egg
Keep in a cold place until needed
Mix with the greens right before serving, scatter the dressing carefully as the flavor is strong

recipes.description: Pumpkin is official New Hampshire's state fruit. There are many recipes for Pumpkin Pie and other sweet recipes, so here is one less common recipe.
recipes.title: Stuffed Pumpkin
ingredients: 1/2 cup finely chopped fully cooked ham
recipes.directions:
Before cooking wash the pumpkin, carve a 6 inch wide circle around the top stem, remove the top, the seeds and the fiber inside
Transfer the pumpkin into a dutch oven, pour boiling water 6 inches deep and seasonings with ½ tablespoon of salt
Simmer covered for 30 minutes until soft, then remove from the heat and dry
Prepare a large sauce pan, heat oil on medium heat and stir fry the meat and the veggies until tender
Let the meat and veggies drain and cool 
Place them in a large bowl, add the rice, oregano, vinegar, pepper, tomato sauce, garlic, ham, eggs, salt and combine 
Put them onto a baking pan and pour the meat mixture in, replace the top and bake in a preheated oven to 350°F for 1 hour
Let it set for 10 minutes before cutting
Cut into wedges, serve hot

recipes.description: These wonderful American-style pancakes are light and moist. They are best made fresh and served up for brunch.
recipes.title: Blueberry Pancakes
recipes.directions:
#Batter – prepare a large bowl, pour flour, baking powder and cinnamon, combine thoroughly
In another bowl mix milk, honey, brown sugar and salt
Pour the liquid ingredients into the dry ones, whisk until well combined and smooth
Mix in the blueberries and let it sit for 15 minutes
#Topping – combine brown sugar with cinnamon
#Maple glaze – pour maple syrup in a bowl and mix it in with confectioners’ sugar and vanilla extract
Heat oil on a large saucepan
Pour the batter onto the pan, using about ¼ c of batter for each pancake
Cook until golden, pour some of the cinnamon sugar topping on the uncooked side of the pancake, then turn it over and cook until golden
Serve the pancakes with the glaze poured over them, serve hot

recipes.description: New Jersey is best known for Saltwater Taffy, which is children's favourite delicacy during the holidays.
recipes.title: Saltwater Taffy
ingredients: 1⁄4 teaspoon peppermint oil (or any other flavor you like)
7 drops red food coloring or 7 drops green food coloring
recipes.directions:
Heat butter on a saucepan, add the sugar, water, salt and corn syrup
Simmer on medium heat and stir frequently until well combined and the sugar melts
Cook until you reach 265°F without stirring, then remove from the heat
Add butter, color and flavoring
Pour into a pan and cool for at least 20 minutes or until elastic enough to handle easily
Brush your hands with butter and pull the taffy until difficult to pull, then cut it into quarters
Process every candy into ½ inch thickness and cut into small pieces with buttered knife
Wrap in plastic foil

recipes.description: Pork Roll was created by John Taylor of Trenton, New Jersey in 1856. Let's try to create an authentic Jersey breakfast.
ingredients: 4 slices pork roll, such as Taylor (about 6 ounces)
4 kaiser rolls, split in half and toasted
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

image.description: Pork Roll Sandwich with Egg & Cheese

recipes.title: Pork Roll Sandwich with Egg & Cheese
recipes.directions:
Prepare the pork meat by scoring it on the edges on 3 or 4 places (it will cook more evenly)
Toast the roll bottoms
On a large saucepan melt the butter on medium high heat, add the pork and fry until golden from both sides (approximately 6 minutes)
Take out the pork and set aside
Add butter to the pan and crack the eggs into it, break the membrane of the yolks and let it cook for about 2 minutes
Flip the omelet over and place a slice of American cheese on each egg
Cover and let the cheese melt (about 30 seconds)
To assemble the sandwich, place one slice of pork on each toasted roll bottom, top with egg and cheese, sprinkle with ketchup if desired and cover with the top bun
Serve immediately

recipes.description: This popular delicacy is among the New Mexico national dishes. Refritos beans are also popular in many Latin American countries.
ingredients: 1 pound dried pinto beans, picked over for stones and impurities
3 cloves garlic, lightly crushed with the side of a knife blade, and minced
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 tablespoon minced fresh cilantro leaves or minced fresh flat-leaf parsley
recipes.title: Frijoles Refritos
recipes.directions:
Rinse the beans and cook them in 8 cups of water
Remove anything that rises to the surface when cooking
After 15 minutes of cooking, pour the beans into a colander and rinse
Clean the pot and put 8 cups of fresh water, start slowly cooking the beans again until soft (about 2 hours) on low heat
Prepare a large skillet and heat oil on it on medium heat
Add the onions and garlic, stir fry until the onions are translucent
Season with salt, pepper and chilli powder and simmer for a few minutes
Add the cooked beans and mash all the ingredients together
Warm, serve with sprinkled cilantro and parsley on top

recipes.description: In New Mexico, green chile is a popular ingredient in a wide range of foods including enchiladas and burritos, cheeseburgers, french fries, bagels, pizzas.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons flour or 2 tablespoons whole wheat flour
1 1⁄2 cups pork stock or 1 1⁄2 cups chicken stock
1 cup chopped roasted and peeled new mexico pepper ("or" frozen "or" canned)
recipes.title: Green Chile Sauce
recipes.directions:
Prepare a large pan and heat oil on medium-high heat, stir fry the onions and garlic until softened (about 3 minutes)
Add flour to the pan, season with salt, pepper and cumin, stir occasionally and simmer for 2 minutes on medium heat
Stir in the stock and cook until fine, mix in the oregano and the chiles
If serving right away, heat well
If storing for later, keep covered in the fridge

recipes.description: Buffalo wings were first prepared at the Anchor Bar in Buffalo, New York, by Teressa Bellissimo. There is also officially Chicken Wing Day (declared July 29, 1977) in Buffalo.
recipes.title: Buffalo Wings
ingredients: 2 1/2 pounds chicken wings, tips removed and wings halved at joint, or wingettes
1/4 cup bottled hot sauce, such as Frank's
Blue Cheese Dipping Sauce, for serving, recipe follows
Kosher salt and cracked black pepper
recipes.directions:
Arrange the raw chicken wings on a plate
Preheat the oven to 425°F
On a large skillet melt butter and set aside from the heat, add the hot sauce, honey, pepper, salt and cayenne pepper, mix until combined, let it cool
When the sauce is cooked, pour it over the chicken wings, coating them from all sides properly
Let the wings marinate at room temperature for about 20-25 minutes
In the meantime prepare the blue cheese dip – in a blender combine the mayonnaise, blue cheese, Worcestershire sauce and sour cream, blend until smooth, season with salt and pepper
Arrange the Buffalo wings on a baking pan lined with greased aluminum foil
Bake the chicken wings in the oven for 45 minutes, rotate them once in the process
Serve hot with the Blue cheese dipping sauce

recipes.description: These delicious muffins are among the New York's national dishes. They are wonderful with cup of tea or coffee.
ingredients: 1 package (3 ounces) cream cheese, cut into 1/4-inch cubes and softened
recipes.title: Apple Muffins
recipes.directions:
Preheat the oven to 375°F
Combine all the dry ingredients in a large bowl
Mix eggs, cream cheese, butter and vanilla in the second bowl, mix until well combined
Pour the liquid ingredients into the dry ones, whisk thoroughly
Add the raisins, walnuts and grated apples
Combine the ingredients for the sugary topping
Fill the muffin cups to 2/3
Scatter with the topping
Bake for 20-25 minutes, let cool and serve

recipes.description: Pulled pork is a method of cooking pork , allowing the meat to become tender enough so that it can be "pulled", or easily broken into individual pieces.
recipes.title: Pulled Pork
ingredients: 1 (3 lb) pork roast, trimmed of all fat
1 1⁄2 tablespoons chili powder (the hot stuff. Chipotle works well, too)
3 garlic cloves (add or subtract to your heart's content)
recipes.directions:
Prepare a slow cooker, put all the ingredients in but the pork
Split the meat into 4 parts
Fry the pork until brown in a heavy bottomed pan over medium high heat
Place the pork into the slow cooker, stir in with the sauce
Cook for 8 hours on low
After 8 hours try if the meat is done with a fork (if it does not shred under the fork it is not done)
Mix the mixture to cover all the pork pieces with the sauce
Warm the buns, coat with horseradish on the bottom half, top with pork, sprinkle with grated cheddar

recipes.description: There is no official state food, but Sweet potatoes is one of the North Carolina's state symbols. So here is an interesting recipe with sweet potatoes.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked and mashed sweet potatoes
recipes.title: Sweet Potato Pecan Pie
recipes.directions:
Preheat the oven to 400°F
Bake the sweet potatoes in the oven, then take them out, peel and mash them
Whisk eggs gently and pour to the sweet potato mash, combining it properly
Season the dough with cinnamon, salt, ginger and sugar, mix in the cream
Pour the mixture into a pie pan
Bake for 45-55 minutes, try with a toothpick if it is done (if it does not stick to the toothpick it is ready)
Topping – broil the brown sugar, pecans and butter, when it goes bubbly (about 3 minutes) cool it and start spreading it on the top of the pie

recipes.description: Lefse is a Scandinavian treat that is especially popular around the holidays. Many Scandinavian-Americans eat lefse primarily around Thanksgiving and Christmas.
recipes.title: Lefse
ingredients: 1 3⁄4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for rolling
recipes.directions:
Put whole unpeeled potatoes into a large pot, pour over with cold water by 2 inches
Bring to a boil and cook for about 40 minutes until the potatoes are tender
When cooked, peel the potatoes and mash them using a fork or a masher
Pour the heavy cream, butter, salt and sugar into a small pot and heat until the butter dissolves
Take 4 cups of the potato mash into a large bowl and pour the milky mixture over it, stir it lightly
Put into a fridge for 30 minutes and let it chill
When completely cooled, take it out of the fridge and sprinkle flour over it, work it gently into the dough
Let it sit in room temperature for 10 minutes
Now you can start making small balls of dough (about 2 tablespoons per serving)
Place the balls on a lightly floured parchment sheet
Roll the balls of dough using a rolling pin into circles with a thickness of approximately 1/16 inch and 7 inches wide
Prepare a non stick pan and heat it
Start scraping the thin layers of dough from the paper into your hand and place them on the pan
Saute for 1 minute, then flip it over and cook from the other side for 30 seconds
Place the finished lefses on a plate, covered with kitchen towel and keep them warm
When serving, sprinkle with sugar and pour melted butter, roll each lefse

recipes.description: This fresh soup is traditional native North Dakota food. And it is popular dish during the summer season.
recipes.title: Summer Corn Soup
ingredients: 4 small red potatoes (or 1 small russet), quartered (peeling, optional)
Sea salt and ground black pepper
3 ears corn (or 1.5 cans), kernels sliced off
2 cups unsweetened plain almond milk (or regular milk if not vegan)
1-2 Tbsp nutritional yeast for a cheesy flavor
recipes.directions:
Stir fry onions and garlic on a large pan on medium heat, saute until brown (3-4 minutes)
Put in the potatoes, sprinkle with salt and pepper and simmer covered for 4-5 minutes
Add the corn (save some for later)
You can either blend the soup or not 
Blend the soup – add half broth and half milk for better creamy texture
#Not blended – use all the broth for better flavor
Pour the broth (the milk) into the pan, reduce the heat to low and cook until the potatoes are tender (about 5 minutes)
#Blending – add 3/4 into a blender and blend until smooth
Put the soup back into the pan and let it simmer (the longer the better)
Serve hot, decorate with chopped green onion and the corn, sprinkle with paprika and black pepper

recipes.description: Ohio is known as the Buckeye state - It is the state tree, the name of Ohio State University's sports teams, a nickname for local residents and the name of the peanut butter and chocolate balls which look like the nuts that fall from the same-named tree.
recipes.title: Buckeyes
ingredients: 12 ounces semisweet or bittersweet chocolate, chopped
recipes.directions:
Prepare a blender and add peanut butter, butter, confectioners’ sugar, vanilla and salt
Blend until smooth and combined properly
Make them into 1 inch balls, arrange them on a parchment paper and freeze them for about 20 minutes or until hard
Chop the chocolate and add the shortening, place into a microwavable bowl and microwave for 2 minutes, stir every 30 seconds until completely dissolved
Pierce every candy ball with a toothpick and cover it in the melted chocolate, but leave a circle as large as an eye still visible (uncovered with chocolate)
Let the excess chocolate drain
Put the buckeyes into a freezer and freeze until hard
Before serving, cover the hole after the toothpick and serve at room temperature

recipes.description: Cincinnati Chili is spiced meat sauce used as a topping for spaghetti or hot dogs, both dishes developed by Macedonian immigrant restaurateurs in the 1920s.
recipes.title: Cincinnati Chili
ingredients: 1⁄2 ounce grated unsweetened chocolate or 2 3⁄4 tablespoons cocoa
1⁄2 teaspoon ground red pepper or 1⁄2 teaspoon cayenne pepper
1 bay leaves or 1⁄8 teaspoon bay leaf powder
finely shredded cheddar cheese (certainly NOT optional)
recipes.directions:
On a large skillet heat oil and stir fry the onions until transparent, add the ground beef and saute until brown
Remove the mixture from the pan and let it drain
Add the beef stock to the mixture and simmer together for 10 minutes
Add all the remaining ingredients and cook uncovered for about an hour
Before serving remove the bay leaf and take out the excess fat
Serve over spaghetti or in hot dog buns
Sprinkle with lots of cheese

recipes.description: Cornmeal Okra is popular Oklahoma delicacy and it is no wonder that fried okra is among the Oklahoma's national dishes.
recipes.title: Cornmeal Okra
ingredients: 2 cups fresh okra, washed and dried well, tips removed
1 canned chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, finely chopped
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.directions:
Heat oil to 350°F in a heavy bottomed pan over medium heat
Arrange paper towels on a baking tray
In a bowl mix the flour, black pepper, garlic powder, paprika and cornmeal
Whisk egg whites with salt until the mixture is foamy
Souse the okra first in the egg whites then in the spicy flour mixture
Start frying the okras in the preheated oil
Turn frequently and fry until light brown
Place them on a tray, let drain on the paper towels, sprinkle with salt
Chipotle sour cream – in a bowl mix the sour cream, chopped chipotle pepper, lime juice and salt and pepper
Serve the okras hot with the Chipotle sour cream dip

recipes.description: Chicken fried steak (also called country fried steak) is an American breaded cutlet dish consisting of a piece of steak coated with seasoned flour and pan-fried. It is among the Oklahoma's national dishes.
recipes.title: Chicken Fried Steak
recipes.directions:
Season the steaks with ¼ teaspoon of salt and pepper from both sides
In a large bowl combine 1 cup flour, 1 teaspoon of salt, cracker crumbs, ½ teaspoon black and red pepper and baking powder
Stir up ¾ cup of milk and eggs
Start coating the steaks first in the flour mixture, then in the milk, then again in the flour
Heat oil in 12 inch saucepan to 360°F
Fry the steaks for 3 to 4 minutes from one side, then turn and fry for 2-3 minutes or until brown
Remove the steaks from the heat, keep them warm in an oven preheated to 225°F
Drain the fat from the steaks, keep 1 tablespoon of the gravy in the pan
Mix ¼ cup of flour, 4 cups of milk, 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 teaspoon of black pepper
Pour the mixture into the pan, whisk constantly over medium high heat and cook for 10-12 minutes
Serve the hot steaks with the gravy

recipes.description: Popular foods traditionally connected with Oregon include hazelnuts, berries, modern maraschino cherries & Dungeness crab.
recipes.title: Roasted Dungeness Crabs
ingredients: 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, plus more for cooking the crabs
4 large Dungeness crabs, 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 pounds each
