2 teaspoons crushed red pepper, or 6 to 8 fresh red chiles, such as serrano, minced and seeded, or to taste
3/4 cup chopped fresh parsley or cilantro leaves
recipes.directions:
Preheat the oven to 450°F
Prepare a large pot and fill into 2/3 with water
Add salt until the water tastes like seawater
Put the peels from the garlic and onion and half of the sliced lemon into the pot and bring to a boil
Place the crabs in the water and simmer for 5 minutes
Remove from the heat and let the crabs cool down 
When the crabs are cold, discard the top shell and apron, take out the gills and cartilage and remove the fat
Wash the crab in cool running water
Put crabs on a dry surface (top side up) and cut lengthwise into halves
In a large roasting pan mix the minced garlic, chopped onion, ½ teaspoon of salt, butter, crushed red pepper, black pepper and olive oil
Put the pan in the oven on the lowest rack and bake for 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the veggies are light brown
Remove from the oven, add the crabs and coat from all sides with the onion mixture
Return it to the oven, bake until the meat is heated and the mixture is stewed onto the shells (13-15 minutes)
Serve hot, decorate with chopped parsley and cilantro

recipes.description: Chanterelle mushrooms are among the Oregon's edible state symbols. So let's try to make soup with fresh Chanterelles.
recipes.title: Chanterelle Soup
ingredients: 6 cups chicken stock, or pheasant, turkey or quail stock (you can go with duck or goose stock if you use morels, cremini or porcini mushrooms)
recipes.directions:
In a large pot cook veloute sauce, heat it 
In another pot melt butter and mix with flour, cook over medium heat for a few minutes (can't get brown!)
Pour the hot veloute over the roux and cook for 20 minutes, stir frequently
Simmer until reduced to ¼ and smooth
#Mushroom base – finely chop the shallots and mushrooms, saute on a pan over medium heat, season with salt, stir fry until the onions are transparent and mushrooms gave up their water
Add saffron into the brandy and pour to the pan, cook on high heat and combine all the ingredients
Let simmer until the brandy is almost gone, then put away from the heat
Pour the mushroom base into a blender and make into puree
After the veloute is reduced to ¼, pour the mushroom puree and mix in properly, cook for about 10 minutes
#Mushroom garnish – chop a few chanterelles lengthwise, saute in a pan until brown, mix the egg yolks with cream and slowly pour about 4 ladles of soup into the eggs, then add it back to the soup and cook (not boil!)
If you want your soup very smooth, put it through a fine-mesh strainer, then return to low heat
Finish your soup with adding the butter, stirring it in thoroughly
Serve with the fried mushrooms in the center and crusty bread

recipes.description: Ruffed grouse is among the Pennsylvania's edible state symbols. So here is one amazing popular recipe.
ingredients: 2 (1 pound) grouse, cut into quarters and patted dry
1/4 cup dry sherry or white wine
1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar, or to taste
recipes.title: Sauteed Grouse with Peach-Balsamic Sauce
recipes.directions:
Prepare a large pan and stir fry the garlic on melted butter over low heat
Simmer for 10 minutes until the butter has a garlic flavor, then take out the garlic
Increase the heat to medium-high and heat the butter, when hot add the grouse and fry until light brown (about 3 minutes) from both sides, take it out 
Add the sherry into the pan and cook for 20 seconds, then pour in the chicken stock, peach jam and tarragon, cook until bubbling and then reduce the heat to medium-low, cook for another 5 minutes under the lid
Pour in the balsamic vinegar, simmer covered for another 2 minutes
Put the sauteed grouse back to the pan, cooked until tender 3-5 minutes

recipes.description: This traditional sandwich is Pennsylvania favorite lunch at the luncheonettes (sandwich shops).
ingredients: 2 fresh Italian rolls or 2 kaiser rolls, split in half crosswise
1⁄2 large green bell pepper, thinly sliced
1⁄2 lb rib eye steak, very very thinly sliced
1⁄3 lb thinly sliced white processed cheese or 1⁄3 lb provolone cheese or 4 ounces melted Cheese Whiz
recipes.title: Philly Cheese Steak
recipes.directions:
Heat oil on a cast-iron saucepan over medium heat
Stir in the bell peppers, onions and saute until golden brown (about 6 minutes)
Put in the minced garlic, season with salt and pepper and cook for 30 seconds
Place the mixture on one side of the pan and add the meat, fry for about 2 minutes until brown
Mix the meat with the sauteed vegetables, add cheese slices on the top and let melt
Warm the buns
Place the meaty filling into the warm buns, serve immediately with condiments if desired

recipes.description: Clam cakes are a summer tradition in Rhode Island. They are particularly popular during "clamming" season when clams are in abundance and it is legal to dig your own.
recipes.title: Clam Cakes
ingredients: Canola or other vegetable oil for frying
3 1/2 cups cake flour, or all-purpose flour
recipes.directions:
Heat oil on a large skillet to 350°F
Make the remoulade, let cool
In a large bowl mix all the liquid ingredients but the beer
In another bowl mix all the dry ingredients until combined
Prepare a plate, cover in paper towels
When oil is heated, add the beer into the liquid ingredients bowl and whisk gently
Start pouring the batter into the oil, one tablespoon at a time, leave enough space between the cakes
Fry for about 30 seconds, turn them over and fry for about 5 minutes until the cakes are golden on both sides 
Place the cakes on paper towels and let them drain, serve hot with the remoulade, Tabasco or tartar sauce

recipes.description: Striped Bass is among the Rhode Island state symbols. And here is one popular recipe.
recipes.title: Grilled Striped Bass
recipes.directions:
In a large bowl mix lime juice, lime zest, cilantro, olive oil and garlic
Season with salt and pepper
Cut 3 diagonal slits through the skin of each bass
Transfer the fillets into the marinade and coat the fish thoroughly from both sides
Place it on a large plate, cover and let marinate in the fridge for 1 hour
Turn the grill to medium high heat
Cook the fish for about 8 minutes from both sides until tender

recipes.description: Oyster season runs from September/October through April. During this season there are plenty of festivals celebrating the oyster to give you a chance to slurp down as many as you can.
ingredients: 28 oysters, preferably from the East coast, scrubbed well
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.title: Roasted Oysters in Beer
recipes.directions:
Preheat the oven to 450°F
Prepare a large baking pan and let it warm in the oven
Pour 2 bottles of beer in a large bowl, top with the towels and let them soak, wring lightly
When the pan is heated pour the bottle of beer into it and add the oysters, sprinkle with salt and pepper
Top them with the soaked towels and bake for 8-10 minutes or until the oysters open (remove the ones that did not)
#Home made hot sauce – in a small bowl mix together all the ingredients
Serve hot with the hot sauce

recipes.description: They are official state snack. Search for them at roadside stands during the summer and early fall because that’s when they are best.
recipes.title: Boiled Peanuts
recipes.directions:
Prepare a slow cooker, add the crab boil, garlic powder, Cajun seasoning, red pepper, jalapenos, salt and peanuts
Pour enough water to cover the peanuts, mix to combine the ingredients
Cover the slow cooker and cook on low until the peanuts are tender (24 hours at least)
Add water as needed in the process, stir from time to time
Drain the peanuts, serve hot or cold

recipes.description: Chislic is original South Dakota's dish, and it varies slightly in preparation from region to region within the state.
recipes.title: Chislic
ingredients: 1 pound boneless lamb leg, cut into 1-inch cubes
recipes.directions:
In a large bowl combine the chopped lamb, chilli powder, garlic powder, onion powder, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper in a bowl
Let it sit in the fridge for 1 hour
Prepare a plate, line with paper towels
Prepare a dutch oven and heat 2 inches of oil in it to 375°F
Fry the meat in small batches to medium rare (about 1 minute) until the crust is nutty brown and soft
Place the lamb cubes onto the lined plate, let drain
Pierce the chislics with toothpicks, serve hot with hot sauce, garlic salt and saline crackers

recipes.description: This delicious cake is among the South Dakota's national dish, but it originally come from Germany. In Germany. German word "kuchen" means "cake".
recipes.title: Kuchen
recipes.directions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F
#Dough – in a large bowl whisk together all the dough ingredients
Knead the dough into one piece until smooth and transfer to a well greased bowl
Cover with a plastic wrap and keep in a warm place until doubled in size
#Filling – prepare a large pan and add all the filling ingredients (except the sugar, cinnamon and fruit), stir on medium heat until thick, then remove from the heat
Place the risen dough on a lightly floured surface and form into little balls, then roll into circles big enough to fit in pie pans
Chop your fruit and arrange onto the pie crust, pour with the filling about ½ cup at each kitchen, scatter with cinnamon and sugar
Bake at preheated oven for about 20 minutes, let cool
Serve cool or at room temperature

recipes.description: Bobwhite quail is among the Tennessee state symbols. So let's try this great recipe.
recipes.title: Roast Quail
recipes.directions:
Pour water or wine in a large pot, season with kosher salt and bay leaves, bring to a boil and then take it off the heat and let cool
Immerse the quail in the pot and let sit for 2 to 6 hours
Preheat the oven to 500°F (or the hottest your oven can get)
Take the quail out from the liquid, pat it dry
Brush with olive oil, butter or lard and season with salt richly, keep at room temperature
Prepare a small roasting pan and place the quail in it (they should not touch each other)
Bake in the oven for 10 to 18 minutes (lower end of the spectrum – juicy, little pink on the inside and sappy, higher end – brown, fully cooked, dry)
Take the quail out of the oven, let it rest for 5-10 minutes, then cut, sprinkle with lemon juice and serve

recipes.description: Memphis-style barbecue is one of the four predominant regional styles of barbecue in the United States, the other three being Carolina, Kansas City, and Texas. It is slow cooked in a pit and ribs can be prepared either "dry" or "wet".
recipes.title: Memphis Ribs
ingredients: 2 racks St. Louis-style pork ribs (about 2 1/2 pounds per rack)
recipes.directions:
#The marinade – combine the coriander, mustard powder, garlic powder, onion powder, brown sugar, paprika, cayenne and salt
Prepare the ribs on a dry surface with the underside facing up
Get rid of the membrane that covers each rib easily with a knife (put it between the membrane and the bone and start pulling the thin layer from the bones)
Rub every rib in the marinade thoroughly
Prepare a baking sheet and cover with a foil, arrange the ribs on it, cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours
Preheat the oven to 300°F
Take the ribs out of the fridge and place them on the baking tray bone side up
Scatter the baking tray with the apple cider vinegar, cover with another piece of foil, fold the edges to seal properly
Place in the preheated oven and bake for 2 hours
After 2 hours, raise the temperature to 375°F, flip the ribs, remove the top foil and bake uncovered for 30 to 45 minutes until the meat is brown and soft
Heat the apple cider vinegar and the brown sugar in a skillet, bring to a boil and then reduce the heat and cook until a glaze forms (3 minutes)
Take the ribs out of the oven, glaze with the prepared vinegar glaze, cut and serve

recipes.description: Chilli con Carne is among the Texas' national dishes, but it originally comes from Spain.
ingredients: 1 (4 pound) beef chuck roast trimmed of excess fat and cut into 1-1/2 inch cubes (see note below)
8 ounces (about 8 slices) bacon, cut into 1/4-inch pieces (see tip below)
2 small yellow onions, cut into 1-inch chunks
3 jalapeño chiles, cored, seeded and finely diced
4 cups ( 32 oz) low sodium beef broth
2 cups water water, plus more for the chili paste and deglazing the pan
recipes.title: Chilli con Carne
recipes.directions:
Prepare a small bowl, add the cumin, coriander, cornmeal, cinnamon, oregano and chilli powders, pour ½ cup of water and mix until you form a paste
Fry the bacon in a large pot over medium heat for about 10 minutes (until the bacon is crispy and there is enough fat in the pan), stirring frequently
Place the bacon strips on paper towels to drain
Throw away all the fat from the pan but a few teaspoons, pour those into a bowl
Put the pan on medium high heat and start frying the meat (do not overcrowd the pan) until golden brown on one side (about 4 minutes)
Transfer the meat onto a plate, pour ¼ cup of water into the pot and stir well from the bottom of the pan, reserving all the flavory bits, pour the gravy over the beef
Pour the bacon drippings from the bowl into the pan, heat to medium heat and saute the chopped onions until tender (about 5 minutes)
Add the minced garlic and jalapenos, simmer for 2 more minutes and then stir in the chilli paste, combine thoroughly and fry for a few minutes until balmy 
Pour the meat broth and whisk properly until the mixture is smooth, scrape the bottom and the edges of the pot
Add the beer, crushed tomatoes, water, cocoa powder, and molasses, stir in the bacon and the beef with the gravy, bring to a boil
Cover and reduce the heat to low, stir occasionally, cook for 2 to 3 hours until the meat is tender

recipes.description: Tortilla Chips and Salsa are official Texas' state snack. This delicacy is very popular in Texas, but also all around the world.
recipes.title: Tortilla Chips and Salsa
ingredients: 2 jalapenos, seeded (seeds added according to spicy level preference)
juice and zest of one lime
recipes.directions:
Prepare the onion, jalapenos, garlic and cilantro, chop roughly
Transfer the veggies into a blender, add salt, sugar, lime juice and zest, blend until all the ingredients are finely chopped
Pour the remaining juice, add the tomatoes, blend 5-10 times until smooth (leave a few chunks)
Put into the fridge for 1 hour
Serve cold with tortilla chips

recipes.description: People called this dish funeral potatoes because it is commonly served as a side dish during traditional after-funeral dinners.
recipes.title: Funeral Potatoes
ingredients: One 30-ounce bag frozen shredded hash brown potatoes, lightly thawed
One 10.5-ounce can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 1/2 cups lightly crushed corn flake cereal
recipes.directions:
Prepare a large saucepan, add 2 tablespoons of butter and let it melt
Add the chopped onion, stir until tender and transparent for about 6 minutes, then add the garlic and simmer until soft (another 2 minutes)
Preheat the oven to 350°F
Combine the contents of the pan with the hash brown potatoes, sour cream, Parmesan, condensed milk, 1/2 cups of cheddar, sprinkle with salt and pepper
Pour the mixture into a casserole dish, sprinkle with grated cheese, melted butter and corn flakes cereals
Put it in the oven and bake for approximately 1 hour

recipes.description: Gelatin was popularized in the west in the Victorian era with spectacular and complex jelly moulds. Today the Green Jell-O is the official Utah's state snack.
recipes.title: Green Jell-O
ingredients: 1 (8-oz.) can crushed pineapple with its juice
recipes.directions:
Prepare a medium bowl, add 1 cup of boiling water, Jell-O and sugar and whisk until well combined for about 2-3 minutes
Pour the lemon juice, pineapple juice and minced pineapple into the bowl, mix and put into the fridge for 45-50 minutes until syrupy
Prepare a whipped heavy cream, carefully stir in the Jell-O
Put the mixture into a pan and put into the fridge until firm, serve cool

recipes.description: These wonderful American-style pancakes are light and moist. They are best made fresh and served up for brunch.
recipes.title: Buttermilk Pancakes with Maple Syrup
ingredients: 3 large Golden Delicious apples (about 1 1/2 pounds), peeled, cored, cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices
1 tablespoon plus 1/2 cup pure maple syrup
recipes.directions:
#Maple syrup apples – in a large nonstick saucepan melt butter over medium – high heat, stir in 1 tablespoon of maple syrup, the apples, stir fry for about 5 minutes until the apples are soft, add ½ cup of maple syrup and sprinkle with cinnamon
#Pancakes – in a large bowl combine the first 6 ingredients, pour the egg, buttermilk and yogurt into another bowl, pour the liquid ingredients into the dry ones, whisk until only little lumpy, pour ½ tablespoons of melted butter
Prepare a large skillet, heat over medium heat
Add a piece of butter and create a thin coating on the pan
Fry the pancakes about 1/3 cup of batter each, do not let them touch each other
Cook the batter for about 3 minutes until golden on one side, flip them and cook until done
Arrange the pancakes on the plates, place the maple syrup apples on top of each

recipes.description: It is no wonder that this delicious pie is among the Vermont's national dishes. It is ideal as a dessert at a family dinner.
ingredients: 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, plus extra for dusting
1 stick cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/4-inch dice
1 cup shredded white or yellow Cheddar, cold
6 Cortland apples (about 2 1/2 pounds), peeled and sliced 1/4-inch thick
6 Granny Smith apples (about 2 1/2 pounds), peeled and sliced 1/4-inch thick
recipes.title: Vermont Apple Pie
recipes.directions:
#Crust – prepare a food processor, pour the salt, sugar and flour into it, mix to combine, toss in the shortening and pulse a couple times to make crumbles
Add the cheese and blend to combine, pour the apple cider vinegar and cold water, blend until moist and a little crumbly
Form the dough into a ball and cover in plastic wrap, split into 2 pieces (one smaller, one bigger)
Place into the fridge and cool for at least 1 hour
#Filling – prepare a large saucepan, melt the butter over a medium heat
Toss in the sugar, lemon juice and zest, nutmeg, cinnamon, salt and apples
Simmer until the apples release water and the mixture is boiling, about 12 to 15 minutes (the apples must be soft, but not overcooked)
Scatter with flour and simmer until the mixture thickens, approximately 1 minute more
Transfer the apples onto a baking sheet, spread them evenly and let them cool in room temperature about 1 hour
Preheat the oven to 425°F, place a baking sheet in the oven to heat
Roll the dough to 12 inches in diameter and 1/8 inch thick, place on the deep dish pie pan, cut the overhanging edges to ½ inch
Pour the filling onto the pie crust
Take the other dough, roll into the same thickness and about 10 inches in diameter, top the filling with it, crimp the edges and fold them under
Make holes into the top dough
Coat the top with a whisked egg with water
Put the pie onto the preheated sheet, bake for 10 minutes
After 10 minutes reduce the temperature to 350°F, bake until the crust is light brown and crispy, approximately 50-60 minutes

recipes.description: Ham Biscuits are also known as an "angel biscuits" or "bride's biscuits". Almost any garden party is complete without these lightened breads.
ingredients: 3 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
8 tablespoons cold lard, cut into small chunks
8 ounces ham, sliced 1/4-inch thick, from a bone-in or boneless ham
recipes.title: Ham Biscuits
recipes.directions:
Prepare a large bowl, combine the baking powder, flour, baking soda and chives
Preheat the oven to 400°F
Add the lard to the blender and process it until crumbly
Form a hole in the center of the dough and pour in the buttermilk, add the lard and stir gently until a smooth batter forms
Place the batter on a floured surface, knead again about 5 times
Roll the dough onto a 1 inch thick layer, cut the biscuits with a 2 ½ inch cutter
Prepare a baking sheet and arrange the dough circles on it, bake for about 20 minutes until puffy and nutty brown, let them cool on a wire rack
In another bowl stir the honey, Dijon mustard and whole grain mustard
Top each cold biscuit with the honey mustard, the ham and biscuit top
Serve at room temperature

recipes.description: These delicious muffins are among the Virginia's national dishes. They are wonderful with cup of tea or coffee.
recipes.title: Blueberry Muffins
recipes.directions:
In a bowl mix the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt
Preheat the oven to 400°F
Prepare the muffin cups or muffin liners (grease them)
Pour oil into a 1 cup measure, add the egg and milk (fill to the brim)
Add to the flour mixture, mix just until combined
Stir the blueberries carefully in the bowl
#Crumb topping – combine cinnamon, sugar and flour, add enough butter and form little crumbs
Fill the muffin paper cups to the top, scatter with the crumb topping
Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes

recipes.description: Steelhead trout is among the Washington's state symbols. So here is one perfect recipe.
ingredients: 1 lb steelhead fillet, with or without skin
additional oil, for greasing baking pan
recipes.title: Broiled Steelhead Trout
recipes.directions:
Preheat a broiler
Line and grease the baking pan
Combine all the ingredients but the trout into a smooth paste
On the prepared baking sheet arrange the trout skin side down, sprinkle with seasoning
Place the trout 2 levels from the heat and cook for approximately 5 minutes 
Transfer the trout to another rack (3rd or 4th), reduce the heat to 325°F
Bake for another 10 minutes or until the fish is tender
Serve hot with salad, steamed vegetables or orzo salad

recipes.description: Grilling the salmon on water-soaked cedar plank give it delightfully unusual smoky taste.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons mild honey or pure maple syrup
1 (2-pounds) salmon fillet with skin (1 1/2 inches thick)
recipes.title: Cedar Plank Salmon
recipes.directions:
Prepare the cedar grilling plank by keeping it in water for 2 hours before cooking
Prepare the grill for cooking on direct heat over medium high gas (or medium for charcoal), open the vents on the bottom and the lid
Combine the honey, mustard, zest, rosemary, season with ½ teaspoon of salt and pepper
Brush the meat with the mixture on both sides, let it sit for 15 minutes
Place the salmon on the plank (skin side down) and grill covered for 13 to 15 minutes until the edges of the salmon are lightly brown
Keep the salmon on the plank for 5 minutes, serve

recipes.description: Traditionally, apple butter was prepared in large copper kettles outside. Large paddles were used to stir the apples, and family members would take turns stirring. And also the Golden Apples are the official state fruit.
recipes.title: Apple Butter
ingredients: 4 pounds assorted apples, peeled and chopped
recipes.directions:
Preheat a dutch oven over medium heat, add the apple cider, brown sugar, apples and ½ teaspoon of salt
Cook almost completely covered for about 20 minutes until the apples are tender
Turn off the heat, pour the lemon juice and season with cloves, vanilla and cinnamon
Transfer the mixture into a blender, pulse until fine
Place the apple puree back onto the pan and simmer for 2 to 3 hours (depends what kind of apples you used) until it turns thick and golden, stir every 30 minutes
Turn off the heat, let it cool completely and store for up to 5 days

recipes.description: The pepperoni roll was created by Giuseppe "Joseph" Argiro at the Country Club Bakery in Fairmont, West Virginia, in 1927. Today it is a popular snack also in other countries.
recipes.title: Pepperoni Roll
ingredients: 1 cup warm water (100 degrees F/40 degrees C)
recipes.directions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F, brush a cookie sheet with oil
In a small bowl combine 1 cup of warm water and ½ teaspoon of sugar, scatter with yeast and set aside for 5 minutes
In another bowl mix ¾ cup of sugar, salt and flour, pour in the yeasty water and add eggs and melted butter
When the dough sticks together, transfer onto a floured surface and knead until flexible and fine (8 minutes)
Grease a large bowl with oil, put in the dough and brush from all sides, cover with a linen cloth and let sit in warm place until double the size (about 1 hour and 30 minutes)
Form the dough back to it's normal size, make 20 balls
Push each ball with your hands into a 4 inch square rectangle, add 3 slices of pepperoni to the center of each roll and 3 more next to it
Fold the dough over the pepperonis, seal the edges properly, arrange onto the cookie sheet
Bake for 14 to 16 minutes until golden brown

recipes.description: The cake dates back to early colonial times in the United States. There is also the National Applesauce Cake Day on June 6 in the U.S.
recipes.title: Applesauce Cake
recipes.directions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F
Whisk together the shortening and sugar, stir in the eggs and mix well 
In a medium bowl mix all the dry ingredients and pour into the creamy mixture along with applesauce
Toss in the nuts, half of the chocolate chips, dry apples and raisins
Pour the mixture into 2 pie pans
Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of brown sugar and the rest of the chips and nuts
Bake for 30-35 minutes

recipes.description: This delicious pastry is among the Wisconsin's national dishes. But originally it came from Scandinavia.
recipes.title: Kringle
ingredients: Fruit, nuts, raisins or jam, of choice
recipes.directions:
Prepare the butter, soften it using potato masher and spread on a waxed paper, let cool
Put the yeast in warm water and let dissolve, then add salt, lemon extract, egg and milk, stir properly
Scatter with flour and knead with your hands into a ball of dough
Cover with plastic wrap and cool 
Place the dough on a lightly floured surface and roll into an 8 by 12 inch rectangle
Divide the butter layer in half
Place 1 half onto 2/3 of the dough
Fold the uncovered part over half of the buttered part, then fold the remaining third over the top, chill
Roll the dough to an 8 by 12-inch rectangle again. Place the rest of the butter layer onto 2/3 of the dough. Fold the same way as before.
Roll the dough to an 8 by 16-inch rectangle (be careful not to break the layering of butter).
Fold in thirds (like above), now you'll have 24 layers of butter, chill
Cut the dough into halves, carefully roll 1 piece at a time until it's about 6 by 20 inches
#Filling – combine all the ingredients until fine, brush the middle third with the filling, add nuts, raisins or jam and fruit
Cover with one edge, water the other one and fold over it, tighten it properly
Preheat the oven to 350°F
Arrange the Kringle into an oval shape and place on a baking sheet, push the dough a little, let it rest covered in room temperature for 1 hour
#Ice – combine water and powdered sugar
Bake until golden for 20-25 minutes, chill, glaze with the powder sugar mixture

recipes.description: Native Americans, trappers, and early settlers in Wyoming territory ate dried meats (buffalo, elk, moose, deer, beef).
ingredients: 4 lbs london broil beef or 4 lbs flank steaks
2 teaspoons cayenne pepper, more if you like it hot
1⁄4 cup soy sauce or 1⁄4 cup low sodium soy sauce
recipes.title: Jerky
recipes.directions:
Cut off all the fat from the meat
Chop the meat into strips about 4 inches long and ½ inches thick
Place the strips into a freezer and cut when slightly frozen
Grind the meat a little
In a large bowl mix all the ingredients
Cover with plastic wrap and place into the fridge for at least 8 hours
Preheat the oven to 150-175°F
Prepare a cookie sheet and line it with tinfoil
Arrange the strips onto it, they can not touch each other
Bake for 6 hours, flip them after 3 hours
When the slices are dry, you can serve or store for later

recipes.description: The Shoshone who were the first inhabitants of the Yellowstone area were known as sheep-eaters. So here is one Wyoming's original lamb recipe.
recipes.title: Lamb Kabobs
recipes.directions:
Place an oiled broiler rack 3 to 4 inches from the heat, preheat the broiler
Chop the meat into cubes
Prepare a large glass bowl, add the garlic, dressing and meat and cool in the fridge for at least 1 hour 
Chop the bacon into 1 inch stripes
Prepare metal skewers and arrange the lamb, mushrooms and bacon on them, sprinkle with salt and pepper
Put it in the prepared broiler rack and cook for 15 minutes, flip it twice
Serve hot, decorate with mint relish
